results.title: Risky business
results.creator_credit: The Geffen Company, Jon Avnet, Steve Tisch and Paul Brickman
results.brief_description: Joel Goodsen is an industrious, responsible and college bound teen whose parents are going on vacation and leaving him in charge of the house. No sooner do Joel’s parents leave when Joel begins to step outside of his conservative and respectable self. Transforming from a straight A high school star athlete to an uninhibited party animal, Joel invites his friends to enjoy his hospitality, as well as his parents’ liquor. Things go from bad to worse when he meets a streetwise callgirl, Lana, who lives the theories of free enterprise and high finance Joel’s been studying. Cast includes Tom Cruise, Rebecca deMornay, Curtis Armstrong, Bronson Pinchot and Raphael Sbarge.
results.creator_credit_for_label: The Geffen Company, Jon Avnet, Steve Tisch and Paul Brickman

results.title: Rio Bravo(Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Armada Productions and Howard Hawks
results.brief_description: Sheriff John T. Chance arrests a gunslinger for a brutal murder. However, the outlaw’s brother is the most powerful rancher on the border and his desperadoes surround Rio Bravo so that Chance can’t get his prisoner out and the U.S. Marshall can’t get in. Hired gunmen slip silently into the little town, waiting for a chance to strike. This classic western combines the talents of John Wayne and Dean Martin with the much acclaimed skill of Howard Hawks.

results.title: Ring 0: Birthday = Ringu 0: Basudei
results.creator_credit: Asmik Ace Entertainment, Ring 0 Production Group, Takashige Ichise, Masao Nagai and Norio Tsuruta
results.brief_description: Ring O: Birthday, a prequel to the phenomenally successful “Ring” and “Ring 2” films by Hideo Nakata, provides the back-story of Sadako - the murdering, vengeful spirit that haunts the living via video-tape. Set in the 1960s, Sadako is a shy student, who earns the wrath of her colleagues when she attracts the attention of the drama club director. Suspicions about Sadako rise when mysterious deaths start to occur. With less thrills and shocks of the originals, “Ring 0” still impresses with its tension and dramatic staging of Sadako’s tragic past. Cast includes Yukie Nakama, Seiichi Tanabe and Yoshiko Tanaka.

results.title: Rififi = Du Rififi chez les hommes
results.creator_credit: Indusfilms, Prima Film, Societe Nouvelle Pathe Cinema, Rene G Vuattoux and Jules Dassin
results.brief_description: Rififi is a classic French noir film, an unforgettable crime movie, based on the novel `Du Rififi chez les hommes’, by Auguste Le Breton. American Jules Dassin directed “Rififi” in France, where he was working in exile after being blacklisted in Hollywood. “Rififi” is the tale of Tony, fresh out of prison and looking for his wife (who’s taken up with another man), seeking retribution. Tony is a man of few words but decisive action. He is seduced into joining his old gang for a risky job - a precious jewel robbery to take place in the dead of the night whilst all of Paris sleeps. Tony’s crew consist of old buddies, Jo (Carl Mohner) and Mario (Robert Manual) and an ace safecracker Cesar Le Millanais (played by Dassin himself under the pseudonym Perlo Vita). Characters are well written and are depicted three dimensionally. The band of thieves is shown to have meaningful relationships with the women in their life, and with each other. Thirty -three minutes of the film are devoted to the crime itself - a wordless, almost soundless scene that is the epitome of heist cinema. Dassin won Best Director at Cannes for “Rififi” in 1955. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: Ride the high country [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Richard Lyons and Sam Peckinpah
results.brief_description: Joel McCrae and Randolph Scott are two ageing cowboys who decide to join up together to safely return a load of gold back from the goldfields to the bank that owns it. However, their motives are widely different: for one it is a chance to prove that he is still capable for work; for the other it is an opportunity to make his fortune and retire. Along the way they pick up a young woman (Mariette Hartley) running away from an abusive father. When her life is threatened their desires and dreams must take second-place to their commitment to the old West’s code of honour. Sam Peckinpah’s beautiful film is an elegy for the old West: for the morality and chivalry that guided the western hero, for the grandeur of the landscape before it was ruined by industry and mining. Using McCrae and Scott as iconic figures from the golden years of Hollywood and contrasting them to the violence represented by the new breed (Warren Oates), Peckinpah’s film also foreshadows the tension between American generations that was to become open confrontation post-Kennedy and post-Vietnam. By the end of the sixties Peckinpah was to completely destroy the western myth in his groundbreaking violent epic “The Wild Bunch”. But “Ride the High Country” is a brief moment of tenderness in the western genre, and McCrae and Scott are the last of the great western heroes. The stunning last moments of this film are an emotionally devastating farewell to American cinema’s most unique genre.

results.title: Ride in the whirlwind
results.creator_credit: Proteus Films, Jack Nicholson and Monte Hellman
results.brief_description: When three innocent cowboys are mistaken for stagecoach robbers, they are forced to become fugitives until they clear themselves of suspicion. Before Jack Nicholson achieved fame in “Easy Rider”, his electrifying talent was evident as the writer, co-producer and star of this taut, highly charged western thriller. Co-starring Cameron Mitchell, Millie Perkins and Harry Dean Stanton.

results.title: Richard III
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions and Laurence Olivier
results.brief_description: Richard III is the story of one man’s unbridled lust for the crown. Richard’s ambition leaves all who oppose him dead, pawns in his ruthless bid for the throne. This is a majestic film in every sense of the word, and one of the greatest films ever produced in England. Directed by, and starring, Laurence Olivier with Ralph Richardson, Claire Bloom and John Gielgud.

results.title: Rich and strange = East of Shanghai
results.creator_credit: British International Pictures and Alfred Hitchcock
results.brief_description: After coming into a small inheritance, a suburban couple, bored with life’s routine, seek a taste of the high life and excitement by going on a world cruise. One of Hitchcock’s personal favourites, the film is a sad/comic reflection upon marriage and the lives of ordinary people thrown into chaos. Stars Henry kendal and Joan Barry.

results.title: Revolution
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Goldcrest, Viking, Irwin Winkler and Hugh Hudson
results.brief_description: The personal story of Tom Dobb, a reluctant soldier in the American Revolution, his son Ned and the renegade aristocrat Daisy McConnahay is set against the larger backdrop of the American Revolution and what it has come to mean. Stars Al Pacino, Nastassia Kinski and Donald Sutherland with Joan Plowright and Annie Lennox.
